fields.description:
The name server for a delegated zone is expected to have an SOA record at the zone's apex.  Eucalyptus's DNS implementation doesn't seem to have one, though, and responds to such queries with SERVFAIL errors:

{noformat}
% dig @10.104.1.216 SOA euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com            
;; Warning: query response not set

; <<>> DiG 9.9.3-rl.13207.22-P2-RedHat-9.9.3-4.P2.fc18 <<>> @10.104.1.216 SOA euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: SERVFAIL, id: 36778
;; flags: rd ad; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0
;; WARNING: recursion requested but not available

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com. IN	SOA

;; Query time: 127 msec
;; SERVER: 10.104.1.216#53(10.104.1.216)
;; WHEN: Tue Sep 24 14:01:04 PDT 2013
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 50
{noformat}
fields.summary: SOA queries for zone apex result in SERVFAIL errors

comments.body: Given the fact that {{eucalyptus._delegateddomain_}} _does_ appear to have an SOA record, it seems that whatever handles SOA queries simply needs to check for a different name.
[~spark], please check this out for a fix in 3.4.  Let us know the difficulty level

Our DNS doesn't seem to handle SOA query correctly (actually any other query type than A/CNAME records). Some behaviors:

1. Query SOA towards delegateddomain (euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com) generates SERVFAIL.
2. Query SOA towards eucalyptus.delegateddomain generates A answer. I think it should either returns no answer (if eucalyptus is not a delegated zone) or correct SOA answer.
[~tjcramer] It is obviously not a one-line fix as we've never implemented this, but the implementation doesn't seem difficult. I can probably fix by tomorrow.

[~gholms] [~tjcramer] I think the fix is doable for 3.4.0 but I think this is a feature improvement (DNS perfection). So I guess there would be no benefit for implementing this in 3.4. Let me know if you disagree.
[~spark], you have the go ahead to fix this issue in the 3.4.0 time frame.

I think we should not fix this in 3.4 after reviewing the DNS related code. There are two different DNS implementation in our code base (legacy and experimental) and I think we should move all legacy codes to experimental architecture, including the DNS for ELB (I guess that's the plan: [~decker] [~neil]). This particular bug lies in legacy code which should be refactored later and the bug does not affect users AFAIK.
Please consider at least documenting this non-standard behavior on the installation guide, since it causes a lot of confusion when configuring DNS/zone delegation.
[~pablo] Thanks for the comment. When you configure the zone delegation, did you encounter the issue due to this specific bug (SOA query not answered by Euca)? If so can you elaborate?

Please consider increasing the priority for this bug. Some strict DNS resolvers expecting a start-of-authority record simply do not work with the Eucalyptus DNS server. For instance a Windows 2008 DNS server without the KB2508835 
patch won't always resolve names, and it is especially bad since it can work for a long time and then suddenly stop resolving names.

IMHO supporting a SOA record is a very basic requirement for any correct DNS server. Also I don't think it should be that difficult to implement since you could just serve static values for everything else than the serial number.

SOA query on eucalyptus' domain should return result. For example:

[root@b-16 clc]# dig @10.111.1.16 SOA b-16.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.23.rc1.el6_5.1 <<>> @10.111.1.16 SOA b-16.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 51332
;; flags: qr aa rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;b-16.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.	IN SOA

;; ANSWER SECTION:
b-16.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.	60 IN SOA ns1.b-16.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. root.b-16.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. 1 3600 600 86400 3600

;; Query time: 2 msec
;; SERVER: 10.111.1.16#53(10.111.1.16)
;; WHEN: Mon Apr 14 00:02:46 2014
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 101

Verified in latest 4.0 packages:

{noformat}
[root@d-12 ~]# dig @10.111.5.136 SOA d-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

; <<>> DiG 9.8.2rc1-RedHat-9.8.2-0.23.rc1.el6_5.1 <<>> @10.111.5.136 SOA d-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
; (1 server found)
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 9732
;; flags: qr aa rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 1, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 0

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;d-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.	IN SOA

;; ANSWER SECTION:
d-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com.	60 IN SOA ns1.d-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. root.d-12.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com. 1 3600 600 86400 3600

;; Query time: 69 msec
;; SERVER: 10.111.5.136#53(10.111.5.136)
;; WHEN: Thu Apr 24 12:53:41 2014
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 101

[root@d-12 ~]# rpm -qa | grep eucalyptus
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-4.0.0-0.0.919.20140423git78ae7056.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-4.0.0-0.0.919.20140423git78ae7056.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-4.0.0-0.0.919.20140423git78ae7056.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-4.0.0-0.0.919.20140423git78ae7056.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-walrus-4.0.0-0.0.919.20140423git78ae7056.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-4.0.0-0.0.919.20140423git78ae7056.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-imaging-worker-image-1.0.0-0.146.140423git61e70cd.el6.x86_64
[root@d-12 ~]#
{noformat}
